title: Build picks up wrong copy of mkl when multiple available
body_html:
@aosokin reports from #6068 (comment)

There might be another related issue with dependencies.
When doing import torch from an anaconda env pytorch uses mkl (libmkl_gf_lp64.so) installed in anaconda root.
Consequently, if the root and the env have different versions (in my case the root had 2018.0.1 and the env had 2018.0.2-1) I was getting this error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/aosokin/local/software/anaconda3/envs/pytorch-master/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 78, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: /home/aosokin/local/software/anaconda3/lib/libmkl_gf_lp64.so: undefined symbol: mkl_lapack_ao_zgetrf

Updating mkl in anaconda root to 2018.0.2-1 solved the problem.

body:
@aosokin reports from https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/6068#issuecomment-377226963

There might be another related issue with dependencies.
When doing import torch from an anaconda env pytorch uses mkl (libmkl_gf_lp64.so) installed in anaconda root.
Consequently, if the root and the env have different versions (in my case the root had 2018.0.1 and the env had 2018.0.2-1) I was getting this error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/aosokin/local/software/anaconda3/envs/pytorch-master/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 78, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: /home/aosokin/local/software/anaconda3/lib/libmkl_gf_lp64.so: undefined symbol: mkl_lapack_ao_zgetrf
```

Updating mkl in anaconda root to 2018.0.2-1 solved the problem.
